quotes.quote: In eternity there is no time, only an instant long enough for a joke.
Eternity is the divine treasure-house, and hope is the window, by means of which mortals are permitted to see, as through a glass darkly, the things which God is preparing.
As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
Now is eternity; now is the immortal life.
Eternity: a moment standing still for ever.
Eternity eludes us, even as a thought.
The experience of eternity right here and now is the function of life. Heaven is not the place to have the experience; here is the place to have the experience.

If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present. Our life has no end in just the way in which our visual field has no limits.
Eternity is not something that begins after you're dead. It is going on all the time. We are in it now.
Eternity was in our lips and eyes.
Eternity gives nothing back of what one leaves out of the minutes.
Every action in our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.
Eternity is a good man's meditation; for by thinking thereon he preventeth sin.
Each day brings opportunity for decisions for eternity.
In the presence of eternity, the mountains are as transient as the clouds.
Only a philosophy of eternity, in the world today, could justify non-violence.
Eternity is a mere moment, just long enough for a joke.
You must live in the present, launch yourself on every wave, find your eternity in each moment.
Eternity is not something that begins after you are dead. It is going on all the time.
Live near to God, and so all things will appear to you little in comparison with eternal realities.
God exists in eternity. The only point where eternity meets time is in the present. The present is the only time there is.
Eternity is not an everlasting flux of time, but time is as a short parenthesis in a long period; and eternity had been the same as it is, though time had never been.
When you live in the light of eternity, your values change.
Eternity has no gray hairs. The flowers fade, the heart withers, people grow old and die, the world lies down in the sepulchre of ages, but time writes no wrinkles on the brow of eternity.
Time is a part of eternity, and of the same piece with it.
Eternity looks grander and kinder if time grow meaner and more hostile.
Eternity is in love with the productions of time.
Time is strange. A moment can be as short as a breath, or as long as eternity.
This life is only a prelude to eternity.
To see eternity was to be exposed to eternity's whims, oppressed by endless dimensions.
Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
Eternity is so certain and so terrible that a thousand lives would not suffice to prepare for it.
